page.title: 09A Typical Farming Family
page.content: The X's live in a typical,large, victorian farmhouse about 2 miles from the village.The 560 acre farm has the soil and climate to make it suitable for intensive arable farming. Condition are also suitable for livestock but the X's employ 3 men and restrict themselves to producing wheat,barley,potatoes, rape and vining peas. The family consists of the parents and two teenage daughters.They have lived in the area for twenty three years. They work hard and are rewarded with a good living.They love the country- side and consider farming a healthy life. In their leisure time they garden,play tennis and golf.They do most of their shopping in nearby Driffield.They holiday in the Lake District or fly to Portugal.
